task.title: Installing from the Tarball for Systems Using Systemd Init
task.shortdesc: You can install the tarball and start it as a service for supported operating systems that use the systemd init system - including .

context.p: installationservice startlaunch Data Collectorservice startFor tarball installation instructions for operating systems that use the SysV init system, see .
This procedure walks through setting the default directories and the default system user and group used to start as a service.
Before you install, you can alternatively use the $SDC_DIST/systemd/sdc.service file to modify the environment variables that define directories and the system user and group.
Installing the full Data Collector as a service requires root privileges.

step.cmd: Use the following command from the directory where you extracted the tarball to copy systemd/sdc.service to the /etc/systemd/system directory:
Edit the /etc/systemd/system/sdc.service file to modify the environment variables that define directories and the system user and group.
Use the following command from the directory where you extracted the tarball to copy systemd/sdc.socket to the /etc/systemd/system directory:
Optionally, edit the /etc/systemd/system/sdc.socket file to modify the port number. The port must match the one defined in sdc.properties. Default is 18630.
Create a system user and group named sdc.

info.p: For example, use the following command to create a system user and group with the next available group ID and user ID: groupadd -r sdc && useradd -r -d <installation dir> -g sdc -s /sbin/nologin sdc

If youâ€™re installing on multiple machines, we recommend explicitly specifying a group ID and user ID to ensure that the IDs are consistent across the machines. Use the -g and -u flags respectively to specify the ID.
